Brave Cornelius Williams (Alexander C. Mulzac) is an upstanding person. He is a successful real estate person who gives back to his community, is good looking, and loves his mamma. We meet Nikki (Erin Sanderson) as a lying determined woman who wants to get her hooks into Brave. There is an instant dislike for a woman known to her co-workers as "Sister Strange." Soon they are married and we find out how strange she is, but no background on her life until the end.

The film intends to show us the value and impact of good parenting, and in doing so, makes the characters overly good and bad, i.e. unrealistic. I was bored for much of the film.

Guide: F-word, sex. No nudity
LOVED THE STORY LINE.
Love this movie
It was unforgettable

Where Hearts Lie, is unparalleled to anything I've seen in a long time. Clifton Powell gave a riveting performance of what it's like to live with Alzheimer's, his performance alone deserves an award. Alexander Mulzac portrayed a positive role model as a loving son and caring father; one that's isn't depicted enough. He's surely to become a household name, the cast and crew were exciting to watch. Kudos to Malik Yoba and Taral Hicks for blessing us with their presence. Mr. Tony Lindsay is a visionary to say the least, his directing is unmatched by far. I look forward to seeing more of his work. This movie will make you smile,cry and feel good all at the same time. Tanya Thompson and Tony Lindsay: Bravo!

The movie didn't give time for the craziness to creep in on us. The character was shown immediately to be crazy. When she came to visit the parents it would have been better to have made her someone lovable especially to the mother. That would have been more powerful because mothers intuition would sense something wrong but in this case the mother was a clueless woman. There was no suspense, a very predictable movie.
As a mom, this movie really opened my eyes to the things so many father's go through. I absolutely LOVE this movie!
Where Hearts Lie is a must see. It has something for everyone. You will not be disappointed.
It was nothing short of amazing. Touched on powerful issues and it was easy to relate to the characters.

I have to say I was shocked at how will the actors preformed some scenes as a mother was hard for me to watch but overall all I enjoyed  this movie and those of you u love a love story with a twist will also.

Def of crazy, but it shows a reality in our community. I was happy to see the "bad" character being of the opposite sex, and not the traditional angry black man movie. In some ways a little scary as a single black man navigating the dating scene.
